133.question: How To Cite a Poem Using APA Style
133.gt: If you want to cite a poem using the APA style, include your quote from a poem in quotation marks if it's less than 40 words, and use forward slashes to indicate line breaks. To cite a longer passage, begin the quote on a new line and indent it to create a block quotation. For your in-text citation, include the author's name, year of publication, and page number, preceded by the letter "p." When it comes to the title, capitalize all major words, place short titles in quotes, and italicize longer titles.
133.pred: To cite a poem using APA style, you would typically include the author's name, the title of the poem, the title of the book or journal, the publisher, and the year of publication. For example, if you were citing a poem from a book, you would write: "Author's Last Name, First Initial. Title of Poem. Title of Book, Publisher, Year of Publication." If you were citing a poem from a journal, you would write: "Author's Last Name, First Initial. Title of Poem. Title of Journal, Volume Number, Issue Number, Publisher, Year of Publication."

262.question: How To Make a Chore Chart
262.gt: To make a chore chart, start by writing out a list of chores that need to be done in your household on a weekly basis. Next, divide the tasks among the members of your household, taking account of each person’s abilities and schedules. Then, draw a chart on a dry erase board with eight columns and as many rows as you have chores. In the first column, list each chore, and on the top row, list each day of the week. Finally, have each person put a check mark in the correct spot with a marker in their assigned color each time they finish a chore.
262.pred: To make a chore chart, you will need wooden craft sticks, a sharpie or label maker, washi tape, two small jars, and sticker labels. First, you will need to make the chore sticks by applying washi tape to the craft sticks and writing the chores on them. Then, you will need to label the jars with "to do" and "done" and place the chore sticks in the "to do" jar. The video also shows how to make a magnetic chore board by applying cardboard stickers to a magnetic board, marking columns with washi tape, and adding magnets to the board.

265.question: How To Make Time for Yourself
265.gt: To make time for yourself, try waking up a little earlier in the morning so you have time to do things before your day starts. If you're really busy because of work, chores, or errands, see if you can delegate some of those tasks to someone else, like a family member or coworker. Also, try to limit your use of electronics since watching TV and scrolling on your phone can take up a lot of your spare time. Instead, schedule an hour or more every evening to focus on doing things you enjoy, like your hobbies.
265.pred: To make time for yourself, you need to be your own good friend and spend time with yourself. You can do this by talking to yourself, being happy with yourself, and enjoying being yourself. You can also spend time with the divine and the supreme to gather strength and recharge.

290.question: How To Save Time
290.gt: To save time, try working on similar tasks in batches to help you work more efficiently. For example, set aside large chunks of time twice a day to reply to e-mails, or prepare all your meals for the week on Sunday afternoons. Additionally, delegate tasks to other people, like asking a co-worker to lead a meeting or having a family member be responsible for doing the dishes. You should also avoid things that can distract you, such as social media apps on your phone or having the TV on while you work.
290.pred: The video provides several tips to save time. One of the tips is to use a drink dispenser to store and deliver laundry detergent, which saves time by eliminating the need to search for a place to store the detergent. Another tip is to use a tissue box to store plastic bags, which saves time by providing a compact storage solution. Additionally, the video suggests using a magnet to attach a hammer or screwdriver to a surface, which saves time by preventing the loss of small items. The video also provides a tip for using a shell to scoop out egg shells, which saves time by preventing the need to dig through the shell with fingers. Finally, the video suggests using tape to mark the temperature of a shower, which saves time by eliminating the need to adjust the temperature each time.

292.question: How To Stay Neat, Clean, and Organized (Teenagers)
292.gt: To keep yourself neat and clean, try to set a daily personal care routine for yourself. Make sure you take a shower every day, or at least every other day. When you hop in the shower, remember to scrub your hair and keep it nice and clean. Try to get in the habit of brushing your teeth at least twice a day - once in the morning, and once in the evening. You might also want to learn how to do your own laundry, so you always have a fresh, clean outfit to wear - ask your parents to teach you.
292.pred: To stay neat, clean, and organized as a teenager, it's essential to establish a routine and stick to it. Start by making your bed every morning, as this sets the tone for the rest of the day. Tidy up for a few minutes while listening to a song to get rid of clutter. Create designated spaces for items like coats, bags, and clean laundry to avoid messes. Regularly declutter and donate items you no longer need. Use a cleaning schedule to maintain your room, and make sure to clean before going to bed to avoid worrying about it in the morning. Finally, use room sprays, candles, or diffusers to keep your room smelling fresh and clean.

321.question: How To Blow up a Balloon With Baking Soda and Vinegar
321.gt: To blow up a balloon with baking soda and vinegar, pour 1–2 inches of white vinegar into a plastic bottle. Next, hold a balloon loosely by the neck, fit a funnel or plastic straw into it, and pour 2 tablespoons of baking soda through it into the balloon. Then, stretch the neck of the balloon over the top of the bottle before lifting the balloon up over the bottle. The baking soda will fall out of the balloon, through the neck of the bottle, and into the vinegar. The 2 ingredients will fizz and react to create carbon dioxide, which will then inflate your balloon!
321.pred: To blow up a balloon with baking soda and vinegar, you need to fill an empty bottle with baking soda, pour vinegar into the bottle, and then place a balloon on top of the bottle. The reaction between the baking soda and vinegar will cause the balloon to inflate.

338.question: How To Dissolve an Eggshell
338.gt: If you want to dissolve an eggshell, start by placing an egg in a glass and adding enough vinegar or cola to cover it. Once the egg is submerged, the chemical reaction between the acetic acid in the liquid and the calcium carbonate in the eggshell will cause the shell to dissolve. For the best results, cover the glass with some plastic wrap or foil, then place it on a shelf in your refrigerator for 24 hours. After a day has passed, carefully replace the vinegar in the glass with fresh vinegar and return the egg to the fridge for another 24 hours. Finally, remove the egg from the fridge to see if the shell is dissolved, and put it back for one more day if it isn't.
338.pred: To dissolve an eggshell, you need to put the egg in a glass and pour white vinegar into the glass to cover the egg. The acid in the vinegar will react with the calcium carbonate in the eggshell and slowly dissolve it. The chemical reaction produces carbon dioxide bubbles. You can see small bubbles forming around the entire egg. You can leave the egg in the vinegar for 24 hours. After 6 hours, the shell is already getting soft and the outer layer is starting to dissolve. Once you've left the egg in the vinegar for 24 hours, the shell has pretty much completely dissolved and they're held together with a very thin membrane which was underneath the shell.

373.question: How To Make a Newton Disc
373.gt: To make a Newton disc, start by cutting out two circles of the same size from a piece of cardboard and a piece of paper and gluing them together. Next, divide the circle into 7 equal triangles and color each section a different color in this order: red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, and violet. Then, slide a pencil thorough the center of the disc and wrap some tape around the pencil above and below the disc so it doesn’t slide around. Finally, spin the disc quickly with your hand to see the colors blend together and appear white.
373.pred: To make a Newton disc, you will need a piece of cardboard, a piece of paper, a pencil, a ruler, and colored markers. First, trace a circle on the cardboard and the paper using the pencil and ruler. Then, divide the circle into sections using the ruler and colored markers. You can use red, blue, and green markers to color the sections. Once you have colored the sections, cut out the circle from the paper and tape it to the cardboard. Finally, push a pencil through the center of the disc and spin it to see the colors blend together.

545.question: How To Paint an Old Wooden Chair
545.gt: Before painting an old wooden chair, wash it with soap and water to remove any debris or dirt. After allowing the chair to dry, use a coarse grit sandpaper to remove any paint chips, then use one with a finer grit to get rid of any scratches or dings. If any of the blemishes are too deep to be sanded out, fill them with wood putty. When you’re done sanding and filling in holes, use a tack cloth to remove any dust. Once the chair is dry, put it on a drop-cloth, apply a spray primer, and allow it to dry. Then, apply several light coats of your chosen spray paint. Allow the chair to dry, then put on a protective clear coat.
545.pred: To paint an old wooden chair, first, sand the chair to remove any old finish and create a rough surface for the paint to adhere to. Next, apply a liquid deglosser to the chair to remove any remaining finish and prepare the surface for painting. Then, use a brush to apply the paint to the chair, making sure to cover all areas evenly. Finally, let the paint dry completely before applying a clear coat to protect the paint and give the chair a glossy finish.

561.question: How To Refinish a Dresser
561.gt: To refinish a dresser, start by removing any paint and stain using coarse-grit sandpaper wrapped around a wooden block or attached to a power sander. Then, once you see the original wood, switch to a medium- or fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out the surface of the dresser. If you're having trouble removing paint or stain, you may need to use a chemical stripper. Finally, once you've sanded down to the raw, original wood, apply a coat of primer and paint or stain the dresser.
561.pred: To refinish a dresser, start by removing the drawers and old hardware. Apply a citrus stripper to the drawers and use a putty knife to scrape off any finishes. Then, apply lacquer thinner to activate the stripper and stop it from continuing to strip the furniture. Next, use a degausser to D gloss the body of the dresser and sand the drawers with 120 grit sanding paper. Apply blue painters tape to the drawer stops and slides to prevent paint from getting on them. Wipe down the body of the dresser with a tack cloth to remove any sand or dust particles. Prime the body of the dresser with Zinser primer and pre-stain the drawers with General Finishes Java stain. Apply white paint to the body of the dresser with a high-gloss finish and add new hardware from Home Depot. Finally, reattach the drawers and enjoy the newly refinished dresser.

2908.question: How To Cook Turnips
2908.gt: Before you cook turnips, cut off their green stalks, rinse them in cool water, and peel them. Then, cut the turnips into thin strips that look similar to French fries. Next, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a pan over medium-low heat. Add 1 cup of onion and sauté it. When the onion begins to soften, add the turnips, along with another tablespoon of olive oil. Finally, cook the turnips for 5 minutes, reduce the heat to low, and continue cooking them until they’re tender.
2908.pred: To cook turnips, first cut the ends off and remove the skin. Then, slice the turnips thinly and dice them into large pieces. Pour enough water to float the turnips in a pot and add salt according to your preference. Taste the water and adjust the saltiness as needed. Bring the water to a rapid boil, then reduce the heat to a slow simmer and cook for 10 to 15 minutes until the turnips are translucent. Drain the water and add additional seasonings like black pepper and red pepper flakes. Serve and enjoy!

2931.question: How To Cook Red Cabbage
2931.gt: Before you cook red cabbage, rinse it, cut off the bottom, and remove the outer leaves. You can then cut the cabbage into wedges to boil or slow simmer it or into slices if you’d rather sauté it. To boil your cabbage, bring it to a boil in salted water and let it boil for an hour or until it’s tender. If you want your cabbage slow-simmered, boil the water before you add the cabbage and salt. Then, simmer the cabbage for 8-10 minutes per side. Alternatively, you can sauté your cabbage in olive oil with onion, apple cider vinegar, and mustard seed.
2931.pred: To cook red cabbage, first, cut the cabbage in half and remove the hard stem. Then, cut the cabbage into thin strips and place them in a pot. Add olive oil and sea salt to the pot and stir the cabbage. Cook the cabbage for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it is cooked to your desired level of doneness.

3578.question: How To Make a Cardboard Cat Igloo
3578.gt: To make a cardboard igloo for your cat, start by cutting out 6 cardboard circles that gradually increase in size. Make sure the biggest circle is large enough for your cat to curl up on, since that will be the floor inside the igloo. Then, cut out 33 more cardboard circles, making the first 10 gradually increase in size and the other 23 gradually decrease in size. With these circles, you'll also need to cut out the inner diameter so when you stack them there's a space inside the igloo for your cat. Additionally, you'll need to cut out an opening on one side of each of the first 21 circles you cut out, which will end up being the entrance to the igloo. After you cut out those 33 circles, cut out 5 more that gradually decrease in size. You don't need to cut out the interior diameter for these. Finish your igloo by stacking and gluing all of the circles together, starting with the first 6 circles you cut out for the floor.
3578.pred: To make a cardboard cat igloo, you will need a piece of cardboard, a pair of pliers, a pair of scissors, a roll of tape, and a cat. First, cut the cardboard into a square shape. Then, cut the wire hangers into two pieces and shape them into arches. Next, poke holes in each corner of the cardboard and insert the wire hangers through the holes. Use tape to secure the wire hangers to the cardboard. Finally, place the cat inside the igloo.

3918.question: How To Make Caramelized Onions
3918.gt: To make caramelized onions, start by removing the onion's skin and cutting the onions into thin slivers. For every 2 and a half pounds of onions add 3 tablespoons of butter and 2 tablespoons of olive oil to a large skillet. Heat the skillet for 2-3 minutes. Then, add the onions to the skillet and season them with salt and pepper. Saute the onions for 5 minutes. Next, add 2 teaspoons of sugar and cook the onions for an additional 20 minutes, stirring frequently to prevent burning. You'll know they're done when the onions are soft and brown. Serve immediately and enjoy!
3918.pred: To make caramelized onions, start by slicing the onions and placing them in a large pan with olive oil. Cook them on medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until they become soft and juicy. Add salt to draw out the moisture and continue cooking until the onions begin to brown and caramelize. This process can take around 10-15 minutes. If desired, add water to the pan to release the caramelized bits of goodness on the bottom. Once the onions are tender and a deep golden brown, you can add wine or liquor for extra flavor. Taste the onions and add seasoning if needed. The result is a sweet and delicious onion garnish that can be used to enhance the taste of various dishes.

4015.question: How To Cut a Straight Line
4015.gt: To cut a straight line without a ruler, start by folding your piece of paper so the fold is where you want the cut to be. Then, crease the fold, open the paper, and fold in the opposite direction along the same crease. Finally, unfold your paper and cut along the straight, creased line with scissors. You can also use a craft knife to cut through the crease if you don't have scissors on hand.
4015.pred: To cut a straight line, you should hold the paper as straight up as possible and use the edge of the scissors as a guide. You can also use the excess of the paper to help you keep the line straight.

4086.question: How To Line a Dress
4086.gt: To line a dress, you’ll need to make the lining out of a thin, lightweight material that stretches as much as the dress itself. You should trace and cut out your lining pieces from a suitable material, like thin satin, crepe, or Viole. Sew the pieces together, then sew your completed lining onto the inside of the dress along all edges, including the neckline and arms. If your dress has a skirt, you'll need to sew the bottom of the lining around the hemline.
4086.pred: To line a dress, you need to make a bodice using the same pattern as the outer fabric. Then, you need to line up the necklines and sew them together. After that, you need to trim the seam allowances and press them towards the lining side. Finally, you need to join the shoulder seams and the lining to the rest of the dress.

4092.question: How To Make a Pillowcase Dress
4092.gt: To make a pillow case dress, start by cutting open the closed end of the pillow case. Next, fold the case in half, cut 2 identical curved holes for arms, and hem the armholes. Then, iron the dress flat before sewing a casing on the front and back. Afterwards, pull ribbons through the casing, and tie them at the shoulders to make straps for the dress. Finally, tie a ribbon around the waist for the sash.
4092.pred: To make a pillowcase dress, you will need to cut out a piece of fabric, fold it in half, and sew the edges together. Then, you will need to cut out the armholes and sew the bias tape around them. Next, you will need to sew the casing for the fabric tie that will hold the dress up on the shoulders. Finally, you will need to make the fabric tie by cutting a strip of fabric, folding it in half, and sewing the edges together. Then, you will need to thread the tie through the casing and tie a bow on the front.

4104.question: How To Make Hamster Chew Sticks
4104.gt: To make your own hamster chew sticks, look for wood that’s unpainted and untreated, like skewer sticks or clippings from a fruit tree that has not been sprayed with pesticides. Make a glue paste from equal parts flour and water and glue 3 short pieces of wood together, then let them dry overnight. To add more flavor to the sticks, add a splash of fruit juice to the glue when you’re mixing it. Once the sticks are dry, give them to your hamster so it can enjoy its treat!
4104.pred: To make hamster chew sticks, you can take a wooden stick and put it in the hamster's seed mix. The stick will get the scent of the seed mix, and the hamster might be more intrigued to chew on it.

5935.question: How To Use Calipers
5935.gt: Before you use Vernier calipers, slide the clamps closed and push the extension rod in all the way. This will zero out the calipers to ensure you get an accurate reading. To measure an object, determine whether you’re taking an external or internal measurement. If it’s external, clamp the jaws around the outside of the object. If it’s internal, extend the inner measurement jaws until they’re pressed tightly against the inside of the object.
5935.pred: The video demonstrates how to use a metric vernier caliper to measure objects to the nearest 150th of a millimeter. The first step is to measure nothing, which helps identify the areas on the caliper where measurements can be taken. The main scale and vernier scale are then used to read the measurement. The main scale is read first, and the vernier scale is used to determine the exact measurement. The video provides examples of how to read the caliper, including a simple measurement of 5 millimeters and a more complex measurement of 5.72 millimeters. The video also includes a disclaimer about the information presented and encourages viewers to practice using the caliper.

6913.question: How To Install a New Toilet Seat
6913.gt: If your toilet's ready for a new seat, start by measuring the distance between the 2 bolts on the toilet bowl so you know what size seat to get. Most toilet seats are the same size, but it's better to check just in case! Once you've bought a new seat that fits, use a flathead screwdriver to pry off the caps on the bolts that attach the old seat to the bowl. If there aren't any caps, you can skip this step. Next, use an adjustable wrench to loosen and remove the nut on each bolt so you can lift the old seat off. When the old seat is off, hold the new seat over the toilet bowl, and drop the bolts into the empty holes where the old bolts were. Finish by threading the nuts onto the bolts to tighten the new seat into place.
6913.pred: To install a new toilet seat, first remove the old seat by unscrewing the bolts. Then, clean the mounting location and pre-assemble the new seat if necessary. Next, align the studs of the new seat with the holes in the toilet bowl and tighten the nuts until the head pops off. Finally, test the operation of the new seat to ensure it is functioning properly.

6947.question: How To Unblock a Toilet when You Have No Plunger
6947.gt: To unblock a toilet without a plunger, start by wrapping a plastic bag around the end of a mop. Then, use the mop to plunge the toilet like you would if you were using a plunger. You can also bend a metal coat hanger so it's curved and then use the curved end to plunge the toilet. If all else fails, try mixing baking soda and vinegar in a bowl and pouring it down the toilet. Let the mixture sit for 5-10 minutes and then flush the toilet.
6947.pred: To unblock a toilet without a plunger, you can use saran wrap. First, cover the toilet with saran wrap, then flush the toilet. The water will flow through the saran wrap and unclog the toilet.

7059.question: How To Make a Tube Top
7059.gt: If you have an old shirt you don’t use, you can easily transform it into a tube top. All you’ll need is a sewing kit, a strip of elastic, and scissors. To get started, first you'll need to cut across the top of the shirt, just below the armpits. You’ll use the bottom half to make your tube top. Then, you'll need to turn the material inside out, fold the cut edge back 1 inch, and sew it together. Make sure you leave a ½ inch gap at the back for the elastic. Once you’ve sewn the hem, you’ll want to cut the strip of elastic to fit around your chest, then feed it through the hem and sew it together in the gap you left.
7059.pred: To make a tube top, you will need an old T-shirt, scissors, measuring tape, and a sewing machine. First, measure around your rib cage and cut the sleeves off the T-shirt. Then, cut the top portion off the T-shirt, leaving two large rectangles of fabric. Even up the fabric by cutting just inside the place where the sleeves were. Turn the fabric inside out, right sides facing together, and use a glue stick to hold the two fabrics together. Divide the measurement in half and mark the spot in the middle of one side of the fabric. Sew a straight line down both sides of the two top pieces. After sewing, cut off the excess fabric on the outside of the stitch, being careful not to cut the stitch. Flip the two top pieces right side out, and you're done.

7114.question: How To Clean Artificial Flowers
7114.gt: To clean silk flowers, start by filling your sink with room temperature water and a few drops of dish soap. Then, gently swish your flowers in the soapy water and rub them lightly to clean off the petals. When you're finished, immediately remove the flowers and gently blot them dry with a clean towel. If your flowers are hand wrapped, avoid swishing them in the water since it can erode the glue. Instead, you can place your flowers in a bag of salt and shake them for 1 minute to remove any dust and grime.
7114.pred: To clean artificial flowers, fill a bucket with warm water and a touch of soap. Dunk the flowers, leaves, berries, and eucalyptus in the water and gently use a cleaning toothbrush to clean the petals, leaves, berries, and other miscellaneous rickrack. You can then give them a shower under some running water. For arrangements that just need the quick touch up, you can use a can of silk and dried flower cleaner to blow off or disintegrate the dust.

7128.question: How To Dry Sunflowers
7128.gt: To dry sunflowers for seeds, let them mature and dry out in the ground if possible, or cut them 1 foot below the flower heads and dry them indoors if you're worried about pests or bad weather. If you dry them in the ground, protect the seeds from birds by wrapping cheesecloth or paper bags around the flowers’ heads once they begin to droop and die. Once the flowers have completely dried, remove the seeds by brushing them off with your fingers or a stiff brush.
7128.pred: To dry sunflowers, you can use a microwave. Place the sunflower on a sheet of wax paper and microwave it for 30 seconds. Check if it's still wet, and if so, microwave it again for another 30 seconds. Repeat this process until the sunflower is completely dry.

7142.question: How To Make a Flower Press
7142.gt: To make a flower press, start by cutting out 2 equal-sized wooden squares that are big enough to cover the kinds of flowers you want to press. Then, drill a hole through each corner of the wooden squares. Next, cut 2 pieces of cardboard and paper so they're slightly smaller than the wooden squares and snip off the corners. Then, layer them on one of the squares and place a bolt through each of the holes you drilled. Finally, attach the other square to the bolts using washers and wingnuts.
7142.pred: To make a flower press, you will need plywood, four carriage bolts, four washers, four quarter inch bolt, four wing nuts, four quarter inch bolt, and a five-sixteenths drill bit. Cut two pieces of plywood with the dimensions of 12 inches by 10 and a half inches. Drill holes at the corners of the boards, and then put a bolt through each hole. Line up the bolts and put the top board on. Use a saw to cut the plywood into the desired shape. Washers and wing nuts can be used to secure the press.

7581.question: How To Make a Terrarium
7581.gt: To make a terrarium, start by choosing plants that are small and shade-loving. Select a glass container that is deep enough for your plants' roots in a shape that you like, then find an indoor location that gets plenty of light and maintains a consistent temperature. Clean out the container, then add a layer of rocks, a layer of moss, and 2-3 inches of potting soil. Add your plants and be sure to keep them watered and cared for as they grow!
7581.pred: To make a terrarium, you will need a glass bottle, a mesh, gravel, a substrate, plants, and water. First, cut the mesh to fit the bottle and place it at the bottom. Then, add a layer of gravel on top of the mesh. Next, add the substrate and plants to the bottle. Finally, add water to the bottle and place the lid on top. The terrarium will maintain itself by evaporating and condensing the water, which will fall back down into the substrate.

7586.question: How To Make Pot Liners for Plants
7586.gt: Pot liners make it easier and cleaner to move plants between pots. To make pot liners for your plants, use a fabric, like burlap, or recycle plastic packaging like milk bottles. Start by placing your material into a pot and mark where you need to trim it with a pen or pencil. Then, use a pair of scissors to cut your material to size. You’ll want the pot liner to be well hidden in the pot but not so small that you can’t easily get hold of it. Once you’ve cut it to size, poke small drainage holes evenly across the bottom of the liner. It’s crucial that water can drain out of the liner.
7586.pred: To make pot liners for plants, you will need a basket, burlap, a piece of cardboard, a rotary cutter, a sewing machine, and zip ties. First, trace the pattern of the basket onto the cardboard and cut it out. Then, cut the burlap into four pieces and sew them together. After that, fold the burlap over the zip ties and attach them to the basket. Finally, fill the pot with soil and your plants.

7775.question: How To Make Movie Theater Popcorn
7775.gt: To make movie theater popcorn, start by melting 2 sticks of butter in the microwave. Then, let the butter sit until it separates into 3 distinct layers, which should only take a few minutes. Next, skim the foam off the top of the butter with a spoon, and pour the middle layer of butter into a separate container, throwing out the solids at the bottom. Finally, drizzle the clarified butter over some popcorn to give it a classic movie-theater flavor.
7775.pred: To make movie theater popcorn, you will need a pot, coconut oil, popcorn, and Flavacol. First, melt the coconut oil in the pot. Then, add the popcorn and Flavacol to the pot. Stir the mixture as the popcorn pops. Once the popping has mostly stopped, remove the pot from the heat. Add butter oil to the popcorn if desired. The resulting popcorn will have a similar taste and color to movie theater popcorn.

8114.question: How To Make a Banana Split
8114.gt: To make a banana split, start by cutting a peeled banana in half lengthwise and placing the halves in a dish. Then, put 3 scoops of ice cream in the dish between the banana halves. Next, drizzle some chocolate or strawberry sauce over the ice cream and add a dollop of whipped cream on each scoop. Finally, sprinkle some chopped nuts over the sundae and place a maraschino cherry on top.
8114.pred: To make a banana split, first, grab a banana off the chain and cut it in half without touching the inside. Peel back the top and cut the banana in half. Then, place the banana in a bowl and scoop three scoops of ice cream on top of it. For the traditional banana split, use chocolate ice cream in the middle, strawberry and vanilla on the outside. For the ultimate banana split, use the mini dip on the classic and the single dip on the ultimate. Place the ice cream scoops in the bowl and add toppings like strawberry sauce, chocolate sauce, and whipped cream. Finally, add nuts and cherries on top of the whipped cream.

8283.question: How To Make Corn Dogs
8283.gt: To make corn dogs, start by poking skewers through the base of uncooked, rinsed hot dogs. Next, make batter by mixing cornmeal, flour, baking powder, and salt, then whisking in milk, eggs, and sugar. Once the batter is smooth, pour it into a tall glass. Then, heat up oil in a frying pan until it reaches 360 degrees Fahrenheit. Now that you’re ready to fry your corn dogs, dip a hot dog in the batter, then place it in the oil, flipping once, until both sides are golden brown.
8283.pred: To make corn dogs, you will need to prepare a batter with flour, baking powder, cornmeal, sugar, salt, milk, eggs, and vegetable oil. Heat the oil in a pot and fry the hot dogs and mozzarella sticks in the batter until they are golden and crispy. Once cooked, drain the excess oil and sprinkle sugar on top. Serve with honey mustard or ketchup.

8516.question: How To Roast Baby Potatoes
8516.gt: To roast baby potatoes, preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit, and rinse 1 pound of potatoes under cool water. In a separate bowl, whisk together 1/4 cup of extra-virgin olive oil, 2 tablespoons of chopped rosemary, 1 minced garlic clove, 1.5 teaspoons salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper. Place the potatoes in a roasting pan and pour the mixture over them, using a spatula to ensure that each potato is coated. Place the potatoes in the oven to roast uncovered for 45 minutes, rotating them 2-3 times while they cook.
8516.pred: To roast baby potatoes, you can follow the steps in the first video. First, cut the potatoes in half and place them in a pot of boiling water. Cook them for 12-15 minutes until they are almost fork-tender but still have a bit of firmness left. Drain the potatoes and set them aside. Then, heat a large pan over medium heat and add a drizzle of olive oil. Add the potatoes to the pan and season them with salt and ground black pepper. Cook the potatoes for 5-7 minutes on one side until a golden crispy crust forms. Flip the potatoes over and cook them on the other side for a few more minutes. Finally, add the garlic butter to the pan and mix it with the potatoes. Serve the roasted baby potatoes with a side of sour cream and chopped dill, if desired.

8616.question: How To Use Measuring Spoons and Cups
8616.gt: To use a measuring spoon, fill the spoon to the brim for both liquid and dry ingredients, unless the recipe says otherwise. If you're using a spoon for a dry ingredient, make sure you level off the ingredient by scraping a knife across the spoon. To use measuring cups, use dry cups for dry ingredients and wet cups for wet ingredients. For most dry ingredients, you should scrape a knife over the top of the cup to level off the ingredient inside. If a recipe calls for a packed cup, press the ingredients down in the cup with the back of a spoon.
8616.pred: The woman in the video demonstrates how to use measuring spoons and cups to accurately measure ingredients for baking. She shows how to level out the flour and sugar in the measuring cups and spoons, and how to measure liquid ingredients using a measuring jar. She also explains the importance of using the correct measuring tools and techniques to ensure that the ingredients are measured accurately.

9098.question: How To Sew a Button
9098.gt: To sew a button, push a threaded needle up through the fabric and first hole. For a two-hole button, simply push the needle down through the second hole. For a four-hole button, push the needle through the hole opposite the one you started on. Repeat if your button has two holes, or alternate the threading between the two sets of holes if your button has four holes. When the button feels secure, push the needle down, tie a knot in the thread, and cut any excess.
9098.pred: To sew a button, you will need a seam ripper, two needles, 24 inches of thread, and an extra button if you've lost the original. First, remove the loose button using the seam ripper, cutting the thread while being careful to avoid poking a hole in the shirt fabric. If the button has fallen off or you've lost it, there should be an extra button or two sewn in on the bottom of the shirt placket on the inside that you can use. Next, thread your needle with approximately 24 inches of thread for a single button. You'll need to double thread the needle to give the best possible strength. Pull the thread through the needle, making both ends of the thread equal in length. To form a knot, wrap the thread around your index finger to form an X. Pinch the X between your index finger and thumb, then slide your index finger back, letting the thread roll forward. Bring your middle finger down in front, then pull the thread with your other hand. You will be left with a solid knot that won't come undone. Now it's time to start sewing. We're going to begin by forming an X. Starting on the back side, we're going to pass the needle through the back of the fabric to the front. You'll continue passing through the front, to the back, and back to the front until you formed an X. We are now going to use the X as a guide for sewing the button. Place the button on top of the X. Then take your second needle and place it on top of the button. The second needle will help us to form the shank, which is a bit of thread under the button that will make it more secure and easier to fasten. Now let's sew on the button. You're going to use the exact same pattern that you used to form the X. Pass through the back of the fabric, going through the first button hole. Pass over the second needle and go through the second button hole. You will need to hold the button and second needle in place with your fingers for the first few passes. But after that, it should be held in place by the thread. Continue going front to back, back to front, through all the button holes. You will go through all the button holes approximately six times. Pull the needle through the back of the fabric. Once that is done, you can now remove the spacer needle as it's time to form the shank. Now wrap it around the thread under the button, going around six complete times. After that is done, you'll pull the needle through the fabric again to the back side. It's time to finish up by creating a couple of knots to secure the thread. Pull the needle through the threads in the back and then pull it through the loop. You just formed to create a knot. Do this a few times and you'll be good to go. Use your scissors to cut off any excess thread. Make sure when sewing that you pulled the thread through completely nice and tight. Otherwise you'll end up having loose threads that just look sloppy.

9497.question: How To Make an Easy Chicken Salad
9497.gt: To make classic chicken salad, boil 2-3 cups of chicken breast for 15-20 minutes, strain the water, and chop the chicken coarsely. Next, combine the chicken with the veggies and apple in a large bowl. Then, mix  the mayonnaise, lemon juice, and berry preserves together in a separate bowl. Add salt and pepper to taste and drizzle the dressing over the salad. Finally, toss the salad and dressing together and serve it at room temperature.
9497.pred: To make an easy chicken salad, you can follow the recipe provided in the first video. Start by chopping up a heaping cup of chicken breasts and adding them to a bowl. Then, add a quarter cup of finely diced celery, two tablespoons of finely diced red onion, and a pinch of salt and black pepper. Mix in two tablespoons of an avocado-based mayo, and stir until well combined. You can serve this salad on a sandwich, with crackers, or in a lettuce cup.

10511.question: How To Make Starbucks Coffee
10511.gt: If you want to make Starbucks coffee, use 2 tablespoons of ground coffee for each 6 ounces of water. Grind whole Starbucks coffee beans just before brewing for the freshest flavor, or purchase a Starbucks blend that’s already ground. Use filtered water heated to 195 to 205 °F, then brew your coffee in a press, a traditional drip coffee maker, or by pouring the hot water over very fine coffee grounds through a cone-shaped filter, all of which are methods used by Starbucks.
10511.pred: To make Starbucks coffee, you need to follow the steps shown in the video. First, you need to put 75 grams of coffee into a French press. Then, add 450 grams of filtered water to the French press. After that, put the lid on the French press and push the plunger down to mix the coffee and water. Let the mixture sit for 12 hours at room temperature. After 12 hours, pour the mixture into a new container and put it in the fridge. Finally, pour the cold brew coffee into a Starbucks cup and add ice, milk, and sugar to taste.

10577.question: How To Clean a Nespresso Machine
10577.gt: To clean a Nespresso machine, first put it in descaling mode. Next, fill the tank with equal parts water and either lemon juice or vinegar and place a container under the coffee outlet. Then, press any blinking coffee button to run the water through the machine and expel it into the container. Pour the water from the container back into the tank to descale again. Once done, rinse all of the parts in water before you go through the descaling process twice more, but this time with clean water instead of solution.
10577.pred: To clean a Nespresso machine, you need to remove the used Nespresso capsule and not let it remain in the extraction system. You should regularly empty the capsule container and drip tray in order to avoid overflowing. You can easily separate them for cleaning. After using your machine for the last time, simply let a cup of water without a capsule flow through in order to wash away any residue left in the flow system. You can empty the system before a period of non-use or for transportation. To enter the emptying mode, press simultaneously the «Espresso» and «Lungo» buttons to turn the machine off. Remove the water tank. And open the lever. Press simultaneously the «Espresso» and «Lungo» buttons for 3 seconds. Both blink alternately Then, close the lever. The machine switches off automatically. Empty and clean the used capsule container and drip tray.

10774.question: How To Make Miniature Furniture
10774.gt: To make a miniature lamp, start by painting a wooden bead in the color of your choice. Then, cut a cotton swab to your desired length, and use a pin to poke a hole in the center of a foam marshmallow. Once you’ve prepared the marshmallow, stick one end of the swab into the hole and the other end into the wooden bead. Finish the lamp by cutting a piece of cardstock for the lampshade, and gluing it in place so it covers the foam. If you want to add a miniature bed, cut out a bed frame from cardboard using an online pattern, and glue it together. Next, wrap some foam around a piece of cardboard to make a mattress, and place it inside the frame. Finally, paint your  bed.
10774.pred: To make miniature furniture, you can start by cutting out pieces of cardboard and covering them in fabric of your choice. For example, in the video, the person cuts out capo strips and pokes holes in one of the long pieces before gluing everything together to make the headboard. They also cut out pieces of cardboard to make the bed frame and cover them in Korean February. Additionally, you can use materials like copper, sponges, and failed to make the mattress. You can also use lollipop sticks, toothpicks, and hot glue to make candles, and wooden craft sticks and paint to make a bedside table. Finally, you can use clear plastic sheets and window color to make picture frames.

10853.question: How To Find a Substitute for Balsamic Vinegar
10853.gt: The best way to make a substitute for balsamic vinegar depends on what you have on-hand. Try mixing 1 tablespoon of apple cider vinegar or red wine vinegar with 1 tsp of sugar. If you have a different type of vinegar, heat 5 parts vinegar and 1 part sugar in a small pot until the sugar dissolves. You can also try to make a substitute of equal parts lemon juice and molasses with a dash of soy sauce.
10853.pred: To find a substitute for balsamic vinegar, you can look for other vinegars that contain acetic acid, such as apple cider vinegar or white vinegar. These vinegars can be used in place of balsamic vinegar in recipes and will provide similar benefits.

10892.question: How To Make Vanilla Extract
10892.gt: To make vanilla extract, start by lining up vanilla beans on a cutting board and slicing each bean lengthwise to cut them in half. Next, put the beans into a bottle of vodka, close the cap tightly, and shake the bottle. To infuse the vodka with vanilla, place the bottle in a cool, dark place and allow the extract to infuse for 2 months, shaking every so often. Then, put a colander over a bowl, pour the extract through, and use a funnel to transfer the extract to amber bottles to protect it from sunlight.
10892.pred: To make vanilla extract, you will need vanilla beans and vodka. First, cut the vanilla beans in half and place them in a bottle. Then, pour vodka over the vanilla beans until they are completely covered. Shake the bottle every few days to mix the vanilla beans and vodka. The longer you let the mixture sit, the stronger the vanilla extract will become. You can use the vanilla extract in cooking or as a gift.

10953.question: How To Build a Pulley
10953.gt: A pulley is a simple machine that makes it easier to lift heavy objects, and you can make your own at home with just a clothes hanger, a pair of wire cutters, a spool, a rod, and a piece of string. First, cut the clothes hanger using wire cutters and place the spool onto the wire of the clothes hanger. Then, bend the wires to close the spool onto the clothes hanger. Hang the clothes hanger from a rod or dowel, like one you'd find in a closet. Finally, loop the piece of string over the top of the spool on the pulley. Now that the pulley is complete, attach lightweight objects to the end of the string to test how the machine works.
10953.pred: To build a pulley, you will need cardboard, a bottle cap, a skewer, and a plastic bottle. First, cut two cardboard circles and a bottle cap. Then, use the skewer to make a hole in the center of the bottle cap and push it onto the skewer. Next, glue the bottle cap onto the cardboard circle. Repeat the process with the other cardboard circle. Cut the plastic bottle in half and use the skewer to make two holes on each side of the bottle. Finally, attach the string to the bottle and test the pulley by pulling it.

10962.question: How To Build Outdoor Fireplaces
10962.gt: To build an outdoor fireplace, make a detailed plan of what the fireplace will be for, where it will go, and what will go around it. Once you know what you want to build, lay a concrete foundation, put a layer of cinder blocks over that Then, build the firebox and chimney out of firebrick and use a jointer and brush to remove bubbles from the mortar. Finish by adding a decorative hearthstone, veneer, and optional gas line.
10962.pred: To build an outdoor fireplace, you will need to follow these steps. First, you will need to unbox the kit and lay out all the pieces. Then, you will need to build the foundation block and make sure it is level and square. Next, you will need to build the fire brick and make sure it is level and flush. After that, you will need to build the smoke chamber and make sure it is level and flush. Finally, you will need to build the chimney and make sure it is plumb and square.

10981.question: How To Get a Land Survey
10981.gt: Before you schedule a land survey, call several local surveying firms and ask for price estimates. Make sure you have your property deed on hand when you call so you can provide information about the size of your property. Once you compare prices, ask for a bid from the firm of your choice. They'll then mail you a bid and a contract to sign and return. Make sure you understand the terms and how long the project will take before returning the form. For help choosing between surveying firms, read more from our reviewer.
10981.pred: To get a land survey, you can use a sight level, a water level, or a laser level. The sight level is a combination of a telescope and a spirit level, and you can use it to measure the relative height between a point of interest and your eyes. The water level is a length of clear vinyl tubing filled with a liquid, and you can use it to measure the height of the water at each end of the tube. The laser level creates a perfect horizontal line that can be used to line up cabinets or tile, and you can use it to measure the height of a surveying rod.

11138.question: How To Change The Brake Pads in Your Car
11138.gt: Before you change the brake pads in your car, make sure it has had time to cool down so the brakes aren’t hot. Then, remove the wheel and the caliper to reveal the brake pads. Snap off the old brake pads and insert the new ones in the same position. If you want, you can spread anti-seize lubricant on the metal contact edges and on the back of the pads to prevent squeaking. Just don’t put lubricant inside the brakes or they won’t work.
11138.pred: To change the brake pads in your car, you need to remove the tire, loosen the nut, remove the caliper, remove the old brake pads, push the piston back in, put the new brake pads on, put the caliper back on, tighten the nuts, put the tire back on, tighten the nuts, lower the jack, and turn on the car and press the brake pedal a couple of times to re-engage the new pads with the disc.

11152.question: How To Fix a Brake Fluid Leak
11152.gt: If your brake fluid is leaking, first, find the source of the leak by looking underneath the car and spotting where the fluid is dripping. For example, if the leak is coming from the wheel, you may have to remove the wheel and check the lines and calipers. To fix a leaky caliper, purchase a caliper rebuild kit from an automotive store or dealership and remove your car’s brake bleeder. Then, disconnect the steel and rubber brake lines and replace them as well if they look cracked or worn out. Strip everything from the calipers so you can blow low-pressure compressed air into them to pop the piston out. From there, replace the piston and put the caliper back together. For more help from our co-author, including how to fix a leak in the wheel cylinder, read on.
11152.pred: To fix a brake fluid leak, you need to locate the source of the leak. In the first video, the man inspects the brake system and identifies the leak. In the second video, he uses a tarp to catch the brake fluid and then inspects the tarp to locate the leak. Once the leak is identified, you can replace the damaged parts, such as the brake line or the master cylinder, to fix the leak.

11534.question: How To Make Garlic Knots
11534.gt: To make garlic knots, start by mixing melted butter, grated parmesan, garlic powder, dried oregano, dried parsley flakes, and salt in a small bowl. Then, unwrap the dough from its packaging, separate it into 16 pieces, and roll the pieces into ropes. Try your best to knot the ropes, but don’t stress if they aren’t perfectly knotted. Once they’re knotted, brush them with the butter and garlic mix and put them in the oven to cook for up to 10 minutes at 400°F.
11534.pred: To make garlic knots, you will need to roll out the pizza dough, cut it into strips, fold them into knots, brush them with olive oil, and let them rise. Then, you will need to make garlic water by adding butter, chopped garlic, parsley, and salt to a pot and boiling it. After the dough has risen, you will need to bake the knots in the oven at 400 degrees for 14 minutes or until golden brown. Finally, you will need to brush the garlic knots with the garlic water and serve them.

12649.question: How To Remove Dish Soap from a Dishwasher
12649.gt: To remove dish soap from a dishwasher, pour 1 cup of vinegar into the dishwasher and run it for a few minutes on a normal cycle. Then, check on the suds and pour more vinegar in if they're still there. You can also sprinkle table salt over the suds and then run the dishwasher, which will help break them down so they disappear. Pouring a cup of olive oil in the dishwasher before running it can also help clear out any dish soap residue.
12649.pred: To remove dish soap from a dishwasher, you need to open the dishwasher and pour a cup of vegetable oil into it. This will help to neutralize the soap and remove any suds. You can repeat this process a few times until the dishwasher is clean.

12993.question: How To Make Natural Outdoor Fly Repellent with Essential Oils
12993.gt: To make natural outdoor fly repellent with essential oils, start by mixing lavender, citronella, eucalyptus, and peppermint essential oils in a bowl. Then, add some vegetable oil and witch hazel and pour the mixture into a metal tin. Submerge a cloth or sponge in the mixture and cover the tin for 24 hours. After 24 hours, open the tin and set it outside in the area you want to repel flies from.
12993.pred: To make natural outdoor fly repellent with essential oils, you will need 2 oz of distilled water, 1 oz of natural astringent, and three drops of each of the following essential oils: lavender, lemongrass, and purification. Mix the ingredients together, put the lid on, and shake it up. The repellent is now ready to use.

13142.question: How To Clean Pool Tile
13142.gt: To clean calcium carbonate scaling on pool tile, scrub the scaling with a pumice stone or nylon bristle brush using circular motions. Just make sure the pool tile and pumice stone or brush are wet at all times so you don't accidentally scratch the tile. If you're having a hard time getting the scaling off, try spraying the tile with a non-toxic, biodegradable calcium releaser, which will soften the scaling without damaging your pool water.
13142.pred: To clean pool tile, you can use a spray bottle of hydrochloric acid from Lowe's. Make sure to wear gloves, eye protection, and long sleeves to avoid getting the acid on your skin. Spray the acid on the tile and let it sit for a few minutes. Then, use a scotch pad to scrub the tile. Rinse the tile with water to remove any remaining acid.

14131.question: How To Cook Breakfast Sausage
14131.gt: To cook pan-fried breakfast sausage, place a medium non-stick skillet on the stove over medium-low heat and let it warm up for 1-2 minutes. Once the pan is hot, add the sausage in a single layer and cook until the sausage is fully cooked, turning the sausage frequently so it browns on all sides. Cook sausage links for 12-16 minutes, or cook sausage patties for 10-12 minutes. Add an additional 2 minutes if the sausage is frozen. Remove the sausage from the skillet and place it on a plate lined with paper towels for 1-2 minutes, then serve.
14131.pred: To cook breakfast sausage, you need to heat a pan on high heat for 10-15 seconds. Then, add water to the pan and let it boil for a couple of minutes. After that, add the sausages to the pan and cook them for 7-8 minutes. You can also cut the sausages in half to get four sides crispy.

14133.question: How To Cook Italian Sausage
14133.gt: If you want to cook Italian sausage on the stovetop, heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add about a quarter-inch of water and a tablespoon of olive oil, then add the Italian sausage. Place a lid on the skillet and cook the sausage over medium-low heat for about 15 minutes, then remove the lid and continue cooking, flipping the sausage every 2-3 minutes, until the sausage is golden-brown or the internal temperature reads 150°-156°F.
14133.pred: To cook italian sausage, you need to steam it first in a pan with a cover and water. After about 10 minutes, you can remove the water and sear the sausage on each side with olive oil. You can also add extra flavor with onions, garlic, or peppers. Cook the sausage for about 5 minutes on each side until it's fully cooked.

15265.question: How To Braise Meat
15265.gt: To braise meat, start by searing each side of the meat in a pan over medium-high heat. Then, transfer the meat to large pot and pour in broth, beer, juice, or water until the liquid covers half of the meat. Next, bring the liquid in the pot to a boil. Once the liquid is boiling, cover the pot and place it in the oven. Cook the meat for 2-6 hours at 350 °F, or until it's tender.
15265.pred: To braise meat, you need to season it first, then sear it in a hot pot with oil until it is deep dark brown on all sides. After that, you should remove the meat and set it aside. Next, add vegetables to the pot and brown them up. Then, deglaze the pot with red wine to release the brown bits on the bottom of the pan. After that, place the meat back in the pot and add stock or water halfway up the sides of the meat. Bring the mixture to a boil, then immediately lower the heat to a simmer. Cover the pot and keep it at a low simmer for one and a half to three hours, depending on the size and cut of the meat. Finally, when the meat is fork tender, it is done.

15282.question: How To Cook Oxtails
15282.gt: If you want to cook oxtails on the stovetop, place the oxtails, salt, and any other seasonings you want to use in a large, heavy stockpot. Cover the oxtails with a combination of beef broth and red wine, then bring the liquid to a boil. After it begins to boil, stir the oxtails, cover the pot, and reduce the heat to medium or medium-low. Let the oxtails simmer for 2 1/2 to 3 hours, stirring every 15 to 30 minutes. If you like, you can make a gravy by heating oil, flour, and liquid from the stock pot in a skillet.
15282.pred: To cook oxtails, you will need to follow the steps shown in the video. First, you will need to wash the oxtails and season them with salt, pepper, and other spices. Then, you will need to coat the oxtails in flour and fry them in a pan with oil. After frying, you will need to add the oxtails to a pot with vegetables, beef stock, and red wine. You will then need to let the pot simmer for several hours until the oxtails are tender and the sauce has thickened. Finally, you will need to serve the oxtails with rice and vegetables.

15283.question: How To Cook Liver and Onions
15283.gt: To cook liver and onions, use a sharp knife to cut your beef or chicken livers into 1/2-inch thick slices. Next, dredge the liver slices in a mixture of flour, black pepper, and salt, so they're evenly coated. When you're finished, cook the liver slices in olive oil over medium-high heat for 2-4 minutes, flipping them over halfway through so both sides are browned. Finally, add chicken or beef broth and 2 sliced onions to the skillet and simmer everything for 15-20 minutes.
15283.pred: To cook liver and onions, start by cutting the liver into pieces and seasoning it with salt, black pepper, and garlic powder. Heat oil in a pan and cook the liver for five to seven minutes until it is cooked through. While the liver is cooking, sauté onions in a separate pan until they are soft and golden brown. Once the liver is cooked, remove it from the pan and set it aside. In the same pan, add the sautéed onions and cook them for a few more minutes until they are caramelized. Finally, place the cooked liver on top of the onions and serve with white rice.

15351.question: How To Roast Meat
15351.gt: Before roasting beef or other meat, bring it to room temperature to ensure that it will cook evenly. Once the meat is ready to cook, place it in the oven uncovered to caramelize the outer portions. You'll want to cook the meat on a higher temperature to start, then roast it for several hours on a lower temperature for a tender final dish. Finally, use a meat thermometer to determine when the roast is done, cover it with aluminum foil, and allow it to rest for 10-20 minutes to seal in the juices.
15351.pred: To roast meat, you should first sprinkle the outside of the roast with kosher salt and let it sit at room temperature for at least an hour or in the refrigerator for up to 24 hours. This will help the meat retain moisture and become more flavorful. If your roast is regularly shaped, you might want to tie it into a more uniform shape before cooking to help it cook more evenly. Searing the meat before putting it into the oven is also important to get a well-browned crust. Make sure to use the right oven temperature depending on the meat's size and shape. Finally, let the meat rest for at least 10 minutes before carving into it to ensure it stays moist and tender.

15379.question: How To Distress Wood Furniture
15379.gt: To distress wood furniture, start by sanding the entire surface with coarse-grit sandpaper to create a smooth base for the new paint to adhere to. Next, give the furniture a new coat of paint, use coarse-grit sandpaper or a sanding block to achieve an uneven, weathered look, and apply the top coat of paint. If you want a more distressed look, add cracks, holes, and scratches to the surface and replace the current hardware with antique or weathered pieces.
15379.pred: To distress wood furniture, you can use a piece of 100 grit sandpaper to sand on areas that would naturally become distressed, like corners, edges, and raised areas. This will give the furniture a more worn and vintage look.

15395.question: How To Remove Paint from Wooden Objects and Refinish Them
15395.gt: If you want to remove paint from a wooden object, sand it down until all of the paint is removed, then clean away the dust using a rug covered in paint solvent. If the paint is thick or the wood is polished, use a scraper to scrape off the paint. Alternatively, apply a chemical stripper to the object using a paint brush, leave it to soften the paint for 30 minutes, and scrape off the paint with a spatula. To finish, sand the item with sandpaper. If you want you're item to have a new finish, try giving it a coat of clear timber varnish.
15395.pred: To remove paint from wooden objects and refinish them, you can use a stripping gel like Citristrip, which is safe and effective. Apply the gel to the surface of the object and let it sit for a few hours. Then, use a scraper to remove the paint. After that, sand the surface to smooth it out and prepare it for repainting.

15409.question: How To Waterproof Wood
15409.gt: To waterproof wood, start by sanding it with fine grit sandpaper to remove any imperfections and prep the surface. Then, use a rag to apply an even coat of linseed oil, walnut oil, or tung oil to the wood and let it cure for 24 hours. Repeat the process 2 more times so there are 3 coats of oil on the wood. When you're finished, let the wood cure for several days before using it.
15409.pred: To waterproof wood, you can use a sealant like ZR44, which is a zero VOC, completely green sealer that is solvent-free and harmless to animals, plants, and the environment. You can apply it with a simple paint brush and let it dry before assembling the furniture.

15466.question: How To Cook Leeks
15466.gt: To cook leeks, start by cutting off the roots and leafy tops from the stalks. Then, add the leeks to a pot of boiling water and turn the heat down to medium-low. Let the leeks simmer for 20-30 minutes or until they're tender. You can also cook the leeks by frying them in a pan with butter or oil until they're crispy and golden brown. Once the leeks are finished cooking, serve them as is or incorporate them into a recipe like fish and rice, mashed potatoes, or baked chicken.
15466.pred: To cook leeks, you can either braise them in oil or boil them in salted water. The woman in the video demonstrates both methods. For braising, she cuts the leeks into fourths and slices them in half. She then places them in a pan with oil and covers them with a lid. For boiling, she cuts the leeks into fourths and places them in a pot of boiling salted water. She stirs the leeks to ensure they are all submerged and waits for them to come to a boil before covering the pot with a lid.

15502.question: How To Grill Vegetables
15502.gt: To grill vegetables on a gas grill, start by preheating the grill for at least 10 minutes. If you have a charcoal grill, heat until the charcoal has turned gray. Next, clean between the nooks and crannies of the grate with a grill brush, and wipe down the grate with a paper towel dipped in oil to prevent sticking. Then, coat your vegetable lightly with oil and place them on the grill. If the vegetables are small enough to fall through the grate, place them in a grilling basket, or wrap them in tin foil with the top left open.
15502.pred: To grill vegetables, you need to follow these steps. First, wash and dry the vegetables you want to grill. Some vegetables, such as asparagus, corn, and mushrooms, can be grilled whole. Eggplant, onions, peppers, and zucchini, cook better when they're cut into pieces. Second, oil the vegetables with a light coat of oil to prevent them from sticking to the grates. A little oil also helps get those beautiful grill marks. For extra flavor, add a marinade to your vegetables. To make a simple, all-purpose vegetable marinade, whisk together a quarter cup of olive oil, a quarter cup of lemon juice, a quarter cup of minced, fresh herbs like, basil, oregano, thyme, or rosemary. And if you like garlic, add 2 cloves, finely minced. Pour the marinade over your vegetables and let them steep in a glass bowl or plastic bag for at least one hour. When you're ready to grill, just shake off any extra marinade to prevent any flare-ups. Third, heat your grill. For gas grilling, preheat on medium for ten minutes. If you're using charcoal, fire it up until there's a good coat of ash. After the grill heats up, clean the grates with a wire brush, and wipe them with oil to prevent your food from sticking. Fourth, grill your veggies. If your vegetables are large or whole, you can cook them right on the grill. Smaller vegetables need a grill basket, so they don't fall into the fire. Flip the basket once or twice, to make sure they're cooked evenly. Small or cut vegetables can also be threaded on skewers for kabobs. Be sure to soak bamboo skewers in water for 20 to 30 minutes to keep them from charring. If you're grilling a variety of vegetables, start with the ones that takes the longest to cook, like eggplants, and onions. Asparagus, mushrooms, peppers, and zucchini generally cook a bit faster. Cooking times will vary depending on the type, and size of vegetables. And how crisp or tender you want them to be. Grilling potatoes, carrots, and beets takes an extra step so they don't char on the outside before their tender on the inside. One trick is to boil them in water until they're partially tender. Then, dry them off, brush with oil, and finish on the grill. Another trick: cut them into bite size pieces and grill inside foil packets with oil, butter, herbs and seasonings. Grilled corn is a summer picnic favorite; and there are several great grilling methods to satisfy your family. For basic grilled corn, simply husk the corn, brush with oil and lay it directly on the grill. Cook for 8 to 10 minutes, turning frequently so it cooks evenly, and gets nice grill marks. Or, husk the corn, and place each ear on a separate piece of aluminum foil, add a dab of butter, and a dash of seasoning. Seal it up and place it on the grill for 20 to 30 minutes. Turn it occasionally for even cooking. For the most concentrated corn flavor, grill the corn right inside the husk. The trick here is to soak the corn, husk and all, in water for 30 minutes. Drain it, and put it on the ground for about 20 to 30 minutes, turning occasionally, so the corn kernels steam, while the husk chars. From garden, to grill, to plate, enjoy fresh vegetables kissed with the smokey goodness of the grill. If you're already grilling meat, toss on a few veggies.

16231.question: How To Clean an Iron with Vinegar

16430.question: How To Make Tepache

Finally, let the mixture stand for 12 hours, strain it through a cheesecloth, and refrigerate it before serving.

17656.question: How To Get Acrylic Paint Out of Clothes

Finally, you can add a bow to the top of the box for a decorative touch.

20868.question: How To Make Muddy Buddies
20868.gt: To make muddy buddies, start by microwaving chocolate chips, peanut butter, and butter for 1 minute. Stir the mixture, then microwave for 30 seconds. Continue stirring and microwaving for 30 seconds at a time, until the mixture is smooth with no lumps. Then, add vanilla and stir the mixture into 9 cups of cereal. Put the cereal in a 2 gallon resealable bag with powdered sugar, and shake the bag to coat the cereal with the sugar. Finally, spread the mixture on a parchment lined baking sheet, and let it cool for 10 to 15 minutes before serving.
20868.pred: To make muddy buddies, you will need to melt one stick of butter and add two cups of chocolate chips to it. Once the chocolate is almost melted, add two cups of peanut butter to the mixture and stir it until it is smooth. Next, pour the mixture over a 14-ounce box of corn chex cereal and gently fold it in. After that, put the cereal mixture into a trash bag and add three cups of powdered sugar to it. Close the bag tightly and shake it until the cereal is coated with the powdered sugar. Finally, pour the mixture onto wax paper and let it cool for five minutes before serving.

20880.question: How To Make Tuna Salad
20880.gt: To make a classic, easy tuna salad, stir a 12-oz can of white tuna, 1/2 cup of chopped celery, 1/2 cup of sliced green onions, and 3 tbsp of chopped sweet pickles in a bowl. Then, make the dressing by combining 1/3 cup of mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon of lemon juice, and 2 teaspoons of fresh dill. When both mixtures are made, stir the tuna and dressing together in a bowl. Cover the bowl and chill the tuna salad for an hour, then serve!
20880.pred: To make tuna salad, you will need a can of tuna, celery, carrots, a dill pickle, mayonnaise, dijon mustard, and lemon. First, open the can of tuna and squeeze out the water. Then, chop up the celery and carrots and add them to the bowl with the tuna. Slice the dill pickle and add it to the bowl as well. In a separate bowl, mix together the mayonnaise, dijon mustard, and lemon. Pour the dressing over the tuna mixture and mix everything together. You can serve the tuna salad on crackers, in a sandwich, or as a protein meal on its own.

20889.question: How To Make Crab Salad
20889.gt: To make crab salad, start by heating butter in a pan, and frying chopped onions and bell peppers for 3 minutes. Next, add flaked crab meat and cook for 3 minutes. Then, in a medium mixing bowl, combine mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, mustard, and parsley. Once the crab meat and vegetables are ready, stir the mixture into the dressing until it's fully coated. Finally, season the salad with salt and pepper, and serve it warm or cold.
20889.pred: To make crab salad, you will need to defrost the imitation crab meat and dice a stalk of celery. You will also need a handful of chopped green onions, a yellow onion, and mayonnaise and ranch dressing. Shred the crab meat and mix it with the celery, green onions, and onion. Add mayonnaise and ranch dressing to taste. Season the salad with cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper. Mix everything together and let it sit in the refrigerator overnight. The salad can be served with pita chips, crackers, or on lettuce.

21786.question: How To Clean Ivory
21786.gt: To clean ivory, dust the surface off thoroughly with a paintbrush to remove minor dirt or impurities. You can also grate a white vinyl eraser and rub the shavings against the ivory to remove the dirt. If you're dealing with more significant soiling, mix a few tablespoons of water with a squirt of mild soap and use a cotton ball or Q-Tip to apply the solution, working on small sections at a time. Finish by drying the ivory with a clean, non-abrasive white cloth.
21786.pred: To clean ivory, you should use rubbing alcohol and a piece of paper towel. Saturate the paper towel with rubbing alcohol and wipe the ivory until the dirt is off. It's important to lightly wipe the black keys as well to clean and disinfect them. Avoid using water on ivory as it can make them yellow over time.

21798.question: How To Clean Mineral Deposits
21798.gt: To clean mineral deposits in your bathroom, empty the toilet bowl, fill it with a gallon of white vinegar, and let it sit overnight before scrubbing the loosened deposits away with a toilet brush. You can also immerse your showerhead in vinegar and use a mixture of vinegar and warm water to wipe away mineral deposits from your tub and shower curtains.
21798.pred: To clean mineral deposits, you can use a rag soaked in vinegar and wrap it around the faucet. Let it sit for an hour, then remove the rag and scrub the faucet with a sponge. Repeat the process if necessary.

21803.question: How To Clean Old Photos
21803.gt: To clean old photos, start by laying the photograph on top of a towel on a clean, flat surface. Next, use a can of compressed air to blow away any dirt or dust from the photogragh. If the photo is particularly delicate, you can use a soft cleaning brush instead. After you’ve removed the surface debris, use an emulsion cleaning cloth specifically made for photos to gently wipe the surface. Then, dry the photo with a hairdryer set on high heat, holding it 10 inches away from the picture to avoid heat damage.
21803.pred: To clean old photos, you will need baby oil and a piece of fabric. First, drip the oil onto the picture and then use the fabric to gently rub the oil in a circular pattern throughout the picture. Be patient and make sure to be gentle. You can also use a paper towel to polish the picture and remove any excess oil. However, it is important to never use alcohol to clean old photos as it can ruin them.

21821.question: How To Clean Rubber Floor Mats
21821.gt: To clean rubber floor mats, start by sweeping loose debris off of them using a broom. Then, spray the mats with a hose to rinse off any remaining dirt and grime. For stubborn stains, scrub them using a rag or brush soaked in soapy water before rinsing off any suds. Finally, hang the mats up to air dry so they don't develop any mold.
21821.pred: To clean rubber floor mats, you can use a garage rubber cleaner or a Maguire Super Degreaser. First, wet the entire floor mat with the product to remove any big dirt or particles. Then, agitate the mat with a brush, depending on the complexity of the mat, you may need to use a finer hog hair brush. Rinse the mat with a hose to remove any dirt and foam. If the mat is still dirty, you can repeat the process. Finally, you can dry the mat with a terry cloth, microfiber towel, or air compressor.

21851.question: How To Clean Your Air Filter
21851.gt: To clean your dry air filter, start by removing the filter from its housing and taking it out of the car. Then, vacuum the filter using the hose attachment to remove residue and dirt. Finally, wipe the filter with a dry cloth before returning it to the car. If you have an oil filter, spray it with mild soap and water after you've removed it from the car. When the cleaner has soaked in, put the filter under running water and rinse it clean. Allow the filter to air dry overnight, then re-oil it and return it to the car.
21851.pred: To clean your air filter, first, remove the air filter from the motorcycle. Then, use a contact cleaner or WD-40 to clean the air boot and wipe it with a clean rag. Next, submerge the air filter in a bucket of solvent or air filter cleaner and let it soak for a few minutes. After that, rinse the air filter with warm water and dish soap to remove any solvent or kerosene. Inspect the air filter for any cuts or tears and discard it if necessary. Finally, let the air filter dry completely before oiling it.

21856.question: How To Clean Your Home with Cat Safe Detergents
21856.gt: To clean your home with cat-safe detergents, try using water, white vinegar, and lemon juice as an all-purpose cleaner. Or, if you need to clean stains out of upholstered furniture or carpet, pour baking soda and hydrogen peroxide over them and let it sit for 10-15 minutes. You can also clean tiles, tubs, and sinks using hydrogen peroxide, white vinegar, and liquid soap.
21856.pred: To clean your home with cat safe detergents, you can use a mixture of baking soda and vinegar. First, sprinkle baking soda on the surface you want to clean, then spray vinegar on it. Let it sit for a few minutes, and then wipe it off with a damp cloth. This mixture is safe for cats and will help remove any odors or stains.

22267.question: How To Make Banana Peel Tea
22267.gt: To make banana peel tea, remove the peels from 4 fresh, organic bananas and place them on a baking sheet. Next, bake the banana peels for about 1 hour at 150ºF until they get dry, which will pasteurize them. Then, pulverize the peels, one at a time, in your blender. Add 1 heaping teaspoon of the pulverized peel to your mug and pour hot water over it. Finally, strain the mixture through a fine-mesh coffee strainer before enjoying the tea.
22267.pred: To make banana peel tea, you need to cut the top and bottom off of a banana, slice it down the middle, and leave the peel on. Then, boil 2 cups of water and add the banana slices to the pot. Let it simmer for 4-5 minutes. Once the timer goes off, turn off the heat and scoop out the bananas. You can eat them if you like, or discard them. Finally, pour the water into a mug and add a little bit of cinnamon and honey to taste.

22360.question: How To Lay Concrete Blocks
22360.gt: To lay concrete blocks, begin by building a frame with 2x4s and pouring concrete into it to prepare a footing. Next, prepare cement mortar by mixing water and dried mortar in a 5 gallon bucket. Then, spread the mortar on the footing and begin stacking the blocks, beginning in a corner. Continue stacking the blocks with mortar in between and check to make sure the wall is level with each new layer.
22360.pred: To lay concrete blocks, you need to start by laying out the blocks dry and ensuring that they are square. Then, you can begin placing the blocks in place, making sure that they are level and aligned with the existing structure. You can use a transit or other tools to ensure that the blocks are level and aligned. Once the blocks are in place, you can apply mortar to the joints between the blocks and use a trowel to smooth out the mortar. Finally, you can use a sponge or other tool to clean up any excess mortar and ensure that the blocks are properly aligned and level.

22543.question: How To Make a Petticoat
22543.gt: To make a petticoat, start by purchasing 4 to 5 yards of tulle or crinoline. Next, measure from the waist seam to the bottom hem of the skirt you plan on wearing over the petticoat, and subtract 1 inch. Then, divide this number by 3 and add 1 inch for the seams to get the width for each of the 3 tiers of the petticoat. Once you have all of your measurements, cut the strips of fabric accordingly, and assemble your tiers with a straight stitch and a ½ inch seam allowance. Finally, after the tiers are done, sew them together.
